bill_title: require employers to provide certain information on pay stubs.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require employers to provide certain information on pay stubs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. An employer shall provide the following information, at a minimum, on any pay stub: (1) Employee's name; (2) Payment date; (3) Employer's address; (4) Hours worked, regular and overtime hours, as applicable, for the payment date and year-to-date; (5) Itemized withholdings, for the payment date and year-to-date; and (6) Gross pay, for the payment date and year-to-date. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
